snippet: Diesel-power vehicles have become more civilized, leaving their noisy, smoky past behind, but even with their impressive fuel economy, they still don’t sell well in the United States.
abstract: Wheels column; diesel-engine vehicles may be popular in Europe due to their good fuel economy and clean-burning engines but they still comprise less than 1 percent of passenger vehicles sold in United States; diesel-power cars and sport utility vehicles are available from growing number of automakers.
lead_paragraph: Diesel-power vehicles have become more civilized, leaving their noisy, smoky past behind, but even with their impressive fuel economy, they still don’t sell well in the United States.

headline.main: As the World Embraces Diesels, Americans Still Play Hard to Get
headline.print_headline: As the World Embraces Diesels, Americans Still Play Hard to Get

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corp
